project.teaser: The EFACA project consists of 6 main objectives at 3 levels. Level 1 consists of three TRL3 demonstrations of technologies relevant to the greening of aviation: (WP1) bench testing of a gearbox combining input from gas turbine and electric motor for an hybrid turbo-electric...
project.objective: The EFACA project consists of 6 main objectives at 3 levels. Level 1 consists of three TRL3 demonstrations of technologies relevant to the greening of aviation: (WP1) bench testing of a gearbox combining input from gas turbine and electric motor for an hybrid turbo-electric propulsion system for a propeller-driven regional aircraft; (WP2) comparative testing of fuel cells with conventional liquid and novel phase cooling, to show the benefits up to 20% of the latter in higher net power, reduced heat losses, and smaller volume and weight also reengineering of fuel cell and structural components to increase power-to-weight ratio up to 80%; (WP3) static ground testing of a complete liquid hydrogen fuel system from cryogenic tank to vaporization and combustion in a wide range of operating regimes and simulation of application to the speed and altitude flight envelope of jet airliners. Level 2 consists of two preliminary designs: (WP7) an 80-seat 1000-km range regional propeller driven aircraft including design and integration of hybrid turbo-electric propulsion; (WP89) a 150-seat 2000-km range jet liner with liquid hydrogen fuel including design and integration of cryogenic tanks and fuel system. At level 3 a road map (WP10) for the achievement of the EU environmental targets for aviation synthetizing conclusions in four steps: (i) current status on (WP4) emissions and (WP5) noise versus future targets and gap to be covered; (ii) assessment of relevant technologies to cover the gaps, including (WP6) battery electric and (WP9) sustainable aviation fuels, besides hydrogen (WP7) fuel cells and (WP8) turbines; (iii) most suitable technology for each class of aircraft (light, small and medium regional, single and twin aisle jetliners), and maturation time of the technology; (iv) contribution of each aircraft class to CO2 and non- CO2 global and local emissions and noise, leading to (WP10) a comprehensive road map of actions for carbon-free or emissions-free flight.
project.title: Environmentally Friendly Aviation for all Classes of Aircraft
project.keywords: Hybrid turbo-electric propulsion (HTEP), Hydrogen fuel cells, LH fueled turbines, Regional aircraft with HTEP, Jetliners using LH or SAF, CO2 and other emissions and noise, Road map for greening aviation

article.title: Hybrid electric propulsion system paints the sky green

result.title: Design of schemes for supplying energy to HTEP
result.description: Deliverable will develop a number of layouts to power the HTEP and evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of these layouts.

result.title: Risk Management and quality and innovation impact assessment strategy
result.description: Provide a risk management framework for the EFACA project, to ensure that adverse situations are properly managed along the evolution of the project. The document includes the processes, tools and procedures that will be used to manage and control those events that could have a negative impact. It exposes the proposed risk management approach of the project for managing and controlling all project risks. Moreover, this report will address the roles and responsibilities of the organization, the risk identification, as well as risk assessment and mitigation plans. (i) 1st version M8; (ii) 2nd version M20; (iii) 3rd version M32; (iv) 4th version M48

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - EFACA (Environmentally Friendly Aviation for all Classes of Aircraft)
result.teaser: The EFACA project consists of 6 main objectives at 3 levels. Level 1 consists of three TRL3 demonstrations of technologies relevant to the greening of aviation: (WP1) bench testing of a gearbox combining input from gas turbine and electric motor for an hybrid turbo-electric...
result.description: periodic

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: ADS-B data usage for aircraft noise and air quality modelling and measurement during specific stages of LTO cycle

details.authors: K.Kazhan, K. Synylo, O. Zaporozhets S. Karpenko

result.title: Specifications for Advisory Board
result.description: This document will describe the expected contribution of the Advisory Board, such as the revision of documents, participation in meetings, etc. It will be discussed in the Kick off meeting.

result.title: Shaping the GTE concept, selection of parameters and design scheme. Determination of GTE mass. Shaping the propeller concept, selection of parameters and design scheme. Determination of propeller mass
result.description: Deliverable will identify the parameters of the main engine components, the basic geometric parameters of the air-gas duct, the engine design diagram, developed a mathematical model of the engine, the choice of control laws and determined parameters in the main design points, selected design diagram of the engine, the evaluation of its mass and overall dimensions.Deliverable will also define the parameters of the propeller; the basic geometric parameters of the propeller; the method of controlling the propeller; the design scheme of the propeller, the evaluation of its mass and overall dimensions.

result.title: Requirements for HTEP elements
result.description: Deliverable will identify critical mass and size requirements (for all elements), required power and fuel consumption for the gas turbine engine, electric engine power and efficiency, required propeller parameters, and required FC performance parameters for HTEP elements.

result.title: Analysis of the Liquid hydrogen system for aero engine applications
result.description: The report describes the technical results of the process simulation of the systems comprising liquid hydrogen tank, cryogenic pump, and vaporizer for use in both gas turbines and fuel cells, which differ, among others, in the pressurization level. The results include also the main technical specification for the main equipment listed above. This deliverable refers to Task 3.1.

result.title: An Overview of the Possibilities, Current Status, and Limitations of Battery Technologies to Electrify Aviation (KS13)

details.authors: Rosa Maria Arnaldo Valdés*, Victor Fernando Gómez Comendador, Maria Zamarreño, Suarez, Francisco Perez Moreno, and Raquel Delgado-Aguilera Jurado
details.journalTitle: International Symposium on Electric Aircraft and Autonomous Systems

result.title: Sustainable Transport and Environmental Safety in Aviation (Sustainable Aviation)

details.authors: Boichenko, Sergii Yakovlieva, Anna Zaporozhets Oleksandr

result.title: Report on the realization of the liquefaction, storage and vaporization test rig and on the update of the combustion test rig
result.description: This report describes the design criteria and the design work of the liquefaction, storage and vaporization test rig. Moreover, it describes the construction procedure, focusing on the issues encountered and the solutions adopted. This report refers to Task 3.3.

result.title: ISEAS’23 Abstract Book

details.authors: T. Hikmet KARAKOÇ Oleksandr ZAPOROZHETS Andrzej LESKI Ali Haydar ERCAN Alper DALKIRAN
details.journalTitle: International Symposium on Electric Aircraft and Autonomous Systems

result.title: Report the promising technologies to reduce aviation noise exposure at airports around the EU and world
result.description: The currently investigated promising technologies (EU Clean Sky and Clean Aviation programs, USA FAA and NASA programs CLEEN and ASCENT) will be evaluated.

result.title: Results of aircraft emission inventory estimation for current fleet and projected trends of aviation neutrality by 2050
result.description: Assessment of aircraft contribution to global emission for current fleet and updated fleet for the CAEP/EUROCONTROL mid-and long-term forecasting scenarios will be delivered. Inventory assessment will be provided for the classes of aircraft

result.title: Review of existing proposals in the field of creating hybrid turbo-electric propulsions for regional aircraft using fuel cells
result.description: Review and analysis of existing and currently developed hybrid propulsion systems for aviation applications, including fuel cells (FC). Technical problems of their production and operation. Advantages and disadvantages of existing and currently developed hybrid propulsion systems.

result.title: Results of aircraft noise assessment at aircraft, airport and fleet levels with complementarily analysis of their calculation and measuring tools
result.description: Assessment of aircraft noise exposure at airport level for current fleet and updated fleet for the CAEP/EUROCONTROL mid-and long-term forecasting scenarios will be delivered. Noise exposure assessment will be realised by calculations at airport level due to change in aircraft design and fleet transformation till 2050.

result.title: Types and roles of battery powered aircraft
result.description: This deliverable will analyse relevant technologies in detail, bearing in mind that they may be different for distinct classes of aircraft. It will also address other issues, gaps or risks factors precluding the proper and timely development and implementation of the market of electrical small short range aircrafts powered by batteries. It will be the outcome of task 6.2 Batteries production and disposal sustainable life cycle

result.title: Exploitation and IPR management Plan and reporting activities
result.description: Description of the overall exploitation strategy and follow-up activities reporting of the consortium and the actions to be carried out by each partner. Detailed outline of the actions until the end of the project and in the 2 years following the project’s end.Description of the guidelines for Intellectual Property Rights (IPR) management as derived from the EFACA Grant Agreement and Consortium Agreement. A procedure is presented covering identification of potential innovations, documentation, tracking and protection of Intellectual Property derived from the EFACA project.(i) 1st report: M6; (ii) 2nd report: M18; (iii) 3rd report: M36; (iv) 4th report: M48

result.title: Report the promising technologies to reduce global aviation emission
result.description: The currently investigated promising technologies for fuel burn and engine emission reduction (EU Clean Sky and Clean Aviation programs, USA FAA and NASA programs CLEEN and ASCENT) will be evaluated

result.title: Management and Coordination Handbook
result.description: This document will guide and support the management and implementation of EFACA, deploying all the relevantinformation and tools for this purpose.

result.title: Effect of Diethyl Ether Addition on the Properties of Gasoline-Ethanol Blends

details.authors: Ribun, V., Boichenko, S., Yakovlieva, A., Chelaydyn, L., Dubrovska, V., Shkyar, V., Wos, P.
details.journalTitle: Systems, Decision and Control in Energy IV. Studies in Systems, Decision and Control, vol 454. Springer, Cham.

result.title: Application of battery technologies to aircraft
result.description: This deliverable will study the current state, as well as the potential and limitations of the battery power for small short-range aircraft including UAM. It will be the outcome of task 6.1 Advances in battery technology

result.title: Technical and economic indicators of the systems.
result.description: Technical specifications and associated operating procedures and costs of acquisition and maintenance.

result.title: Preliminary shaping of the concept and typical flight profile of the aircraft with HTEP. Preliminary requirements for HTEP
result.description: Deliverable will tentatively conceptualize the aircraft, taking into account HTEP with fuel cells, forming preliminary requirements for HTEP with respect to safety issues and its operation when flying from sea level to cruising altitude

result.title: Shaping the FC concept of hydrocarbon fuel – electrical energy
result.description: Deliverable will define the basic parameters of FC, develop the FC design concept with an estimate of its mass and overall dimensions; form the conditions for FC placement in the aircraft design, taking into account the hydrogen feed scheme.

result.title: Rationale for the choice of design solutions in the development of liquid hydrogen in aircraft fuel systems.
result.description: Components of the liquid hydrogen system from storage tank to combustion chamber. Available technologies to meet cryogenic requirements of the liquid hydrogen.

result.title: Shaping the FC concept of hydrogen – electrical energy
result.description: Deliverable will define the basic parameters of FC, develop a FC design concept with an estimate of its mass and overall dimensions; form the conditions for FC placement in the aircraft design, taking into account the hydrogen feed scheme.

result.title: Shaping the vaporizer concept, determination of its mass
result.description: Deliverable will develop the concept of the evaporator, taking into account the possible design and layout, the type of hot coolant; investigate the features of the hydrogen boiling process using experimental data and CFD modeling; determine the design of the evaporator and its mass and dimensions.

result.title: Report on hydrogen-fired propulsion
result.description: The report describes the process simulation of pure-hydrogen fired gas turbines, touching also on the expected issues of flame stability and NOx formation. This deliverable refers to Task 3.2.

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: A DMP describes the data management life cycle for the data to be collected, processed and/or generated by EFACA project. Detailed information on the procedures that will be implemented by the EFACA complying with national and EU legislation will be provided.(i) 1st report: M6; (ii) 2nd report: M18; (iii) 3rd report: M36; (iv) 4th report: M48

result.title: Substantiating The Expediency of Using Hydrogen Fuel Cells In Electricity Generation

details.authors: Boichenko S., Danilin O., Shkilniuk I., Yakovlieva A., Khotian A., Pavlovskyi M., Lysak Roksolana, Shamanskyi S., Kriuchkov A., Tarasiuk O.

result.title: ISEAS’23 Abstract Book

details.authors: Sergii Fil, Dmytro Berbenets, Khaustov Andrii, Urban Oleksandra and Bondarchuk Oleksandr
details.journalTitle: International Symposium on Electric Aircraft and Autonomous Systems (ISEAS-23)

result.title: Communication and Dissemination Plan
result.description: Definition of how, when and where to communicate the project’s activities and results to a wide range of target groups. Will include the general communication activities (common to the whole consortium) and the contribution of all partners, as each partner will complete a table with their planned dissemination events and their possibilities of “spreading the word” about the project. Communication materials: Project logo and identity, leaflet, poster, roll-up, templates will be developed.

result.title: Modern Technologies in Energy and Transport

details.authors: Boichenko S., Zaporozhets A., Yakovlieva A., Shkilniuk I.
details.journalTitle: Studies in Systems, Decision and Control, vol 510. Springer, Cham

result.title: Current pathways for SAF production
result.description: Description of the situation in Europe and worldwide about the production of SAF with emphasis on the new pathways approval and the perspectives on the emerging techniques (Task 9.1).

result.title: Improving the calculation module for estimating pollutant emission from conventional and hybrid regional aircraft

details.authors: Synylo K.,Makarenko V., Krupko A., Tokarev V

result.title: Selection of criteria for evaluating HTEP schemes
result.description: Deliverable will review existing comprehensive criteria for evaluating the effectiveness of a propulsion system as part of an aircraft. New criteria for evaluating HTEP efficiency are selected or proposed, with environmental friendliness in mind.

result.title: Development of a cognitive model for the analysis of relationships in the airport environmental management system

details.authors: Horobtsov, I., Cherniak, L., Radomska, M., Tykhenko, O., & Synylo, K.
details.journalTitle: Ecological Safety and Balanced Use of Resources Journal

result.title: Recommendations to the project, safety instructions and environmental safety when using hydrogen.
result.description: Operating aspects of liquid hydrogen including volatility, flammability, venting, modes of operation and safety.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
